overview_of_class: This class will introduce students to the basics of information design and data visualization?the craft of organizing and representing information, numbers, and data sets in static and interactive graphics. After bolstering their visual literacy with case studies of successful and muddled information design, students will use basic statistical analysis to find stories in data, then storyboard and build both static and interactive graphics to publish online using JavaScript.
name: Special Topics
title: JOUR JOUR 480-0-20 Special Topics
enrl_requirement: Enrollment Requirements: Only students in the MSJ program may enroll in these classes

descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value: This class will introduce students to the basics of information design and data visualization?the craft of organizing and representing information, numbers, and data sets in static and interactive graphics. After bolstering their visual literacy with case studies of successful and muddled information design, students will use basic statistical analysis to find stories in data, then storyboard and build both static and interactive graphics to publish online using JavaScript.

descriptions.name: Registration Requirements
descriptions.value:
MSJ Program only;
5-week course,
prerequisite: Interactive Storytelling with JavaScript.

subject: JOUR

overview_of_class: This will be a reporting class, involving important and timely issues of security and civil liberties.? Using advanced public-affairs-reporting techniques and being focused on Chicago, students will specialize in specific issues and publish reports in multiple media.
name: Special Topics
title: JOUR JOUR 480-0-21 Special Topics
